name: Hesperia Playa Dorada Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the Hesperia Playa Dorada. It was a first class hotel. Spotless in all areas with 5 pools to choose from. The food was the best I have experienced in a European hotel with buffet style meals. Always plenty of choice and it never ran out! The only thing i would mention is that it is favoured mainly by Spanish which did not bother myself or my daughter, but a younger family may have problems as the children are unlikely to find many other English children. We only had a couple of English families staying there when we were there. Evening entertainment was a bit hit and miss being mainly aimed at the Spanish audience. Need to brush up on your Spanish if you stay here. Would thoroughly recommend it for couples though. Great position opposite the beach and just a short walk to the Marina and Playa Blanca shops and restaurants along the lovely promenade.
reviews.title: Loved the Hesperia Playa Dorada

reviews.text: We had a junior suite for the stunning price of Euro 69 per night. Room had a terrace with sea view, was very very spacious and well maintained. Included in the room rate there was a very good buffet-style breakfast. I regret I haven't found this resort earlier.
reviews.title: Great deal, excellent stay.

likes.disliked: — A lot of mosquitos coming into the room...

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Just got back from a week at the Hesperia. Hotel is in one of the best locations as it is about 8 minutes walk from the new Rubicon Marina - which has some nice restaurants and shops. A very peaceful way to spend a morning. They have a small market there on saturdays and wednesdays. There is another market near the centre which was basically africans selling bags and belts and where very pushy. The hotel was better than expected after reading some of the earlier reviews. We had room 119 which was on the outside and on the ground floor. We had a superb view of Playa and the port . The beach was clean and safe with a good beach bar that did snacks/drinks during the day and a nice place to have a drink/cocktail in the evening. The hotel restaurant was large and airey. Food was the same sort of thing you get in most spanish hotels. Could have done with something a bit spicier. It was a bit bland after a couple of days but ok. Breakfast had a good selection including freshly squeezed juices which were lovely. We sat outside for most of our meals. Pools were nice with plenty of sunbeds - could have done with a few more umbrellas. Pool was not heated but still ok to swim in. Mostly Spanish with a few Germans and English staying here. We booked through Expedia in May and got a good deal. We were'nt interested in the entertainment but it looked ok. All in all we enjoyed our stay as all we wanted was a relaxing holiday with walks along the prom, which went on for miles. Would recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location. A nice stroll to the Marina Rubicon and a little further to the older part of Playa Blanca.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was good - clean and well maintained. The food was buffet style - lots of choice and generally well done. Wines not too expensive.
reviews.title: Relaxing Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two main pools - one heated, one not! But with the sea so close why bother?
reviews.title: Ok but needs improvements to truly rate the four stars

likes.disliked: — The beds were not comfortable and the room could have been cooler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are excellent - even smiling as I murdered their language!
reviews.title: Shame about the food

likes.liked: — Location, bedroom, bacony, views from room

reviews.title: Could not fault this hotel
reviews.text: I checked this hotel out through Tripadvisor beforehand and now understand why almost all the reviews were so positive. The room was spacious and clean, the bed comfortable ; the pool was first-class ; and while we always have reservations about going half-board, in this case we found the evening buffet service to be excellent, with a good choice of hot meals, salads and desserts. Often in the past, we have foregone our hotel evening meal for several nights, just for the experience of eating out elsewhere in the resort. This time, we felt no such desire.
We also rate Playa Blanca as the best resort on Lanzarote by some distance (we've seen the others). We love the long promenade. And the weather for our pre-Christmas week was fabulous.
reviews.title: Cool, Calm and Quiet

likes.liked: — Large, well appointed rooms, with separate toilet and bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in November with 2 friends - we each had our own room, with a seaview (although we were at the back of the hotel, so it was quite a distance!) and balcony. Rooms were a very good size, with separate toilet and bath rooms, and were cleaned every day. The balcony had a table and 2 chairs. Unfortunately no coffee maker or kettle which was greatly missed. The hotel is very nice - with a lovely bar, pools, nightly entertainment, gym (although you have to pay extra), and 2 restaurants. We chose full board, but I would recommend just getting B&B. The dinners were all buffet and we got tired of it after just 2 days. Plus everybody seemed to be in an incredible rush to get their food, like it was going to run out or something - a bit too pushy for me. The breakfasts were good, with a good selection of either hot or cold food. The food in the pool restaurant, The Papagayo, was excellent for lunch. The hotel is very close to the beach, and shops and restaurants in either direction along the promenade. There were a lot of German people staying -- mostly 60-70 age range, a few British, and some Spanish, and only a handful of children. The hotel is incredibly quiet - I didn't hear a thing at night. We had trouble being understood by the gym assistant who didn't speak any English, but the rest of the staff spoke at least some English. I would recommend taking your own towel for the beach and pool, otherwise you have to rent one, which I think was 2 Euros a day.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for a second time this July. We re-booked as we couldn't wait to return, but were slightly concerned that it might not be as good the second time around....we needn't have worried. The service, food, room, pool, bars and atmosphere were all just as good as our first visit in Oct 04. The location is perfect - it's your choice whether you stay in the hotel and relax, have a wander to some gorgeous shops and bars, or venture the other way out of the hotel to the beach or the shops and cafes in Playa Blanca.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: Both our visits have taken place during term-time - I imagine it might have a different, busier feel should you choose to go in high season, but think that this will be true of most similar hotels and resorts.
reviews.title: Great holiday in Hesperia Playa Dorada

likes.liked: — Great location, pools and very well kept

description: Located off the sparkling Costa del Papagayo on the charming island of Lanzarote, the Hesperia Playa Dorada is an idyllic destination for relaxation and renewal. Gaze out on endless azure water and sky, interrupted only by pristine white sands and the lush greenery of our gardens. Enjoy this beautiful backdrop while taking a dip in one of our five swimming pools, participating in a game of tennis or simply lounging in a chaise with a refreshing cocktail.
